name: Cold Iron (Low-Grade)
desc: Cold iron armor sickens certain creatures that touch it. A creature with weakness to cold iron (such as most demons and fey) that critically fails an unarmed attack against a creature in cold iron armor becomes sickened 1. A creature with weakness to cold iron is sickened 1 as long as it wears cold iron armor.
craftRequirement: at least 70 sp of cold iron + 7 sp per Bulk

hints.desc: A creature with weakness to cold iron (such as most demons and fey) that critically fails an unarmed attack against a creature in cold iron armor becomes sickened 1. A creature with weakness to cold iron is sickened 1 as long as it wears cold iron armor.

name: Silver (Low-Grade)
desc: Silver armor sickens certain creatures that touch it. A creature with weakness to silver that critically fails an unarmed attack against a creature in silver armor becomes sickened 1. A creature with weakness to silver is sickened 1 as long as it wears silver armor.
craftRequirement: at least 70 sp of silver + 7 sp per Bulk

hints.desc: A creature with weakness to silver that critically fails an unarmed attack against a creature in silver armor becomes sickened 1. A creature with weakness to silver is sickened 1 as long as it wears silver armor.

craftRequirement: at least 150 gp of cold iron + 15 gp per Bulk.

desc: Silver armor sickens certain creatures that touch it. A creature with weakness to silver that critically fails an unarmed attack against a creature in silver armor becomes sickened 1. A creature with weakness to silver is sickened 1 as long as it wears silver armor.
craftRequirement: at least 150 gp of silver + 15 gp per Bulk

name: Adamantine (Standard-Grade)
desc: Adamantine armor has a shiny, black appearance and is amazingly durable.
craftRequirement: at least 200 gp of adamantine + 20 gp per Bulk

name: Darkwood (Standard-Grade)
desc: Darkwood armor is 1 Bulk lighter than normal (or light Bulk if its normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on armor that normally has light Bulk). It's easier to wear than normal wood armor, reducing the Strength score necessary to ignore its check penalty by 2 and reducing its Speed penalty by 5 feet.
craftRequirement: at least 200 gp of darkwood + 20 gp per Bulk

name: Dragonhide (Standard-Grade, Acid)
desc: Dragonhide armor is immune to one damage type based on the type of dragon it is made from (as listed in the table below). Wearing armor made from dragonhide also grants you a +1 circumstance bonus to your AC and saving throws against attacks and spells that deal the corresponding damage type. Black or copper Acid Blue or bronze Electricity Brass, gold or red Fire Green Poison Silver or white Cold
craftRequirement: at least 200 gp of dragonhide + 20 gp per Bulk

hints.desc: Wearing armor made from dragonhide grants you a +1 circumstance bonus to your AC and saving throws against attacks and spells that deal Acid damage.
The dragonhide armor is immune to Acid damage.

name: Mithral (Standard-Grade)
desc: Mithral armor is 1 Bulk lighter than normal (or light Bulk if its normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on armor that normally has light Bulk). It's easier to wear than normal metal armor, reducing the Strength score necessary to ignore its check penalty by 2 and reducing its Speed penalty by 5 feet.
craftRequirement: at least 200 gp of mithral + 20 gp per Bulk

name: Elven Chain (Standard-Grade)
desc:
Elven chain is a chain shirt made of mithral that glitters in even the faintest light. It grants a +2 item bonus to AC and has no check penalty.

Created by elven artisans employing ancient crafting techniques, elven chain is exceptionally quiet. Unlike other chain shirts - even other mithral chain shirts - elven chain does not have the noisy trait. This suit of armor can be etched with runes like any other mithral chain shirt.
craftRequirement: at least 3,125 sp of mithral

name: Cold Iron (High-Grade)
desc: Cold iron armor sickens certain creatures that touch it. A creature with weakness to cold iron (such as most demons and fey) that critically fails an unarmed attack against a creature in cold iron armor becomes sickened 1. A creature with weakness to cold iron is sickened 1 as long as it wears cold iron armor.
craftRequirement: at least 10,000 gp of cold iron + 1,000 gp per Bulk.

name: Orichalcum (High-Grade)
desc: Orichalcum armor can be etched with four magic property runes instead of three due to the magical empowerment of orichalcum. If you are wearing armor made of orichalcum, the armor grants you insights into the future, granting you a +1 circumstance bonus to initiative rolls.
craftRequirement: at least 27,500 gp of orichalcum + 2,750 gp per Bulk

hints.desc: Orichalcum armor grants you insights into the future, granting you a +1 circumstance bonus to initiative rolls.
